body: This was made for not reset field during hot reload. Do you have a reproducible example?

Thank you for the quick reply!

I don't have a reproducible version right now, but I can tell you that the build process for the app I'm working on is nonstandard. We're installed react-hook-form in our app via npm and we're creating a bundle by referring to this specific file:

node_modules/react-hook-form/dist/react-hook-form.umd.js

That's how i'm able to access your lib on the frontend. 

I'm not used to seeing a reference to `process` in umd builds, I see other libs creating separate files for dev and prod. Are you able to do anything like that, or maybe guard the `process` reference so that it doesn't fail if not defined? Thanks again.
take a look at this beta: react-hook-form@5.4.3-beta.1 let me know if this fix your problem.
did you have a chance to test the beta version?

hello @bluebill1049 and thank you for reaching out again! i was able to use the umd file as-is from the current version by modifying our build process slightly, similar to the replace that you're doing in the commit referenced above.

Thanks again for the quick responses and the resolution. It's good to see lib authors committed to their projects and gives a lot of confidence in choosing this package. Take care üëç
hey @leonidez üëç  I closed the issue because the code has been merged. can you do a double check if this works for you `react-hook-form@5.4.3-beta.1` before I release the real version?
Sure, I can take a look this weekend. Will let you know.
Thank you @bluebill1049 this worked! I just updated to the latest react-hook-form and I was able to remove the workaround code from my build process. Thanks again! üëç
This fixed the UMD build, but the ES6 modules build still checks for proces.env.NODE_ENV. I'm using it in the browser which now supports ES6 modules. Should I create a new issue?

issue.title: ES6 module build includes references to `process.env.NODE_ENV`

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: üìã React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
The ES6 module build includes references to `process.env.NODE_ENV`, which breaks browser usages -- browsers now support ES6 modules. This is hidden by `react-scripts` in Codesandbox.io because it provides a definition for process.env.NODE_ENV.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Use Rollup to create an ES6 module build that runs in the browser.
2. Pass `register` to the `ref` prop as done in just about every example.
3. Run the code in the browser.
4. Open the JS console and note the "process is not defined" error.

**Codesandbox link (Required)**
I flipped a table trying to get Codesandbox to **not** use create-react-app. I hope you don't mind if I just created a dedicated repo with reproduction instructions in the README:

https://github.com/spaceaardvark/react-hook-form-bug1

**Expected behavior**
The browser build should not encounter or use process.env.NODE_ENV.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- OS: Ubuntu 20
- Chrome
- v86.0.4240.198

**Additional context**
From conversation in #1441 after it was closed.
